author: pacrox2

text:
From favorite to least favorite, I'd go: 3, 6, 2, 5, 4, 1.
I'd put a pretty huge gap between the first and last three, though. 3, 6, and 2 are significantly better imo.
author: wertq1111

text: What people don't like about 5? It ended up being... my favorite, I think.
author: Maurice Chagall

text: @Maurice Chagall Just to clarify, I didn't dislike 5 at all. I liked it a lot, and I wouldn't have beaten it twice if I didn't. I guess that, when it comes down to it, i'm just not a huge fan of the soul unison system. It felt very limiting to me: sacrificing a chip (also meaning you only get to choose 4 chips that turn), and then getting a form that only lasts for 3 turns (and correct me if i'm wrong, but then that soul can't be used anymore in that battle), and they made it better in 5, but 4's soul unisons were pretty weak.
author: wertq1111

text:
@wertq1111 Same, liked 5 a lot but it wasn't my favorite. 

I did feel like 5 had some of the catchiest music, though! Whenever I heard the boss theme while playing, I just got so pumped. xD
author: I'M LOOKING FOR A SPRITE SPONSORSHIP

text:
@wertq1111 I also feel that your enjoyment of MMBN5 is directly related to how much you enjoy the Liberation Missions. I loved them, but, I understand why other people wouldn't like them.

Also, it seems that people liked Team Colonel more than Team Protoman. Which is understandable, because Team Colonel is way cooler even if they're worse gameplay-wise barring a couple of gamebreakers.
author: maltheopia

text:
After playing 2 and 3, 4 was a let down.

Also blue version has Bowlman, the best man.

text: Always wanted to get into this series
author: bdr

text: My favorite game in the series so far, but I've yet to play 4+. I played this game quite a long time ago, so this is another series I really need to get back to. Big fan! I really like the atmosphere in these games and the battle system is one of my favorites in an RPG.

text:
@Richard Rodriguez
Gonna have to strongly disagree on 5, the ideas were good but terribly executed. Also Team Protoman was ridiculously lame compared to Team Colonel in terms of power.
author: Osha

text: 4's emotion system combined with the dark chips is really good. If you like SRPGs I'd give 5 a shot cause it has a lot of elements of one in it while still have Battle Networks combat. Avoid 6.

text: My personal opinion is that 4 is amazingly bad, as it lacks a real depth or good story, 5 is debatable, 6 manages to recapture some good elements

text:
Of the last three, I actually only finished 6. Which was pretty good, it's between 6 and 2 for my favorite of the series after 3.

text:

text: @TrainerAlec 4 also had a terrible music change; they tried to swap music engines along with the artstyle, and the music did not turn out well at all.
author: Fellshard

text: Battle Network 6 is by far the best game that came out after the first 3. I enjoyed it almost as much as I did 2 and 3, and it was a fantastic end to the series.

text: Have to agree, 6 was also my favorite. As for internet themes, I would say 1 and 2 probably had the best.
